section.name: Overview
section.p: Undigester provides a Digester-like way of serializing arbitrary objects to XML.

subsection.name: Status
subsection.p: Undigester has been completely redesigned from scratch, to improve and clean its behaviour and maintenance. Current version, 0.6b3, is the result of a major refactoring at design level of the 0.4 series.

tr.td: $Date$

Fixed bug #123.
Also, rules can be grouped together inside RuleSets, so that complete DTD can be defined using single objects.
Added support for choosing whether to output null properties or not, in GetPropertyRule.
WebExtension has unhidden bug #122, which is now solved.

UndigesterWebXmlTest#testServlets() is now working, reaching version 0.5.
Fixed bugs #1, #2, #3, and #4.
UndigesterWebXmlTest#testSimpleServletAndWelcomeFile() is now working correctly.

Already working unit tests passed again, after branching logic.
UndigesterWebXmlTest#testSimpleServletAndWelcomeFile() is almost working.
Implemented some logic to use the tree hierarchies: nodes and rules, to find out whether a rule should be applied to a concrete node.

Early-access support for chainable rules, to resolve rule conflicts.
Added new aspect to enforce access protection to ChainableRule.
Improved Undigester to perform a two-step process: first, build the complete tree graph; second, apply remaining rules.
Enhanced the build process to seamlessly support AspectJ. Tracing and debug-enhancer aspects added. Implemented first aspect.xml -> build.xml integration.
Implemented an aspect to help debugging.
Added new unit test, web.xml-oriented.
Unit test passed: test3LevelArrayUnparse() Bean classes used just for testing purposes refactored to make them more meaningful.
Unit test passed: test2LevelArrayUnparse() Added index to child nodes to avoid attribute conflicts.
Unit test passed: test2LevelUnparse() Done some design refactoring.
Unit test passed: testFlatMix2Unparse()
Unit test passed: testFlatMixUnparse()
Second unit test passed: testFlatUnparse()
First unit test passed: testSimpleUnparse()
Added basic tree browsing logic, a couple of rules and their tests.
A heavy redesign has been started.
Maintenance release: cleaned direct precondition checks, refactored methods, and fixed minor issues. Applied Checkstyle over the classes as well.
Used ContractChecker preconditions, and refactored (simplified) the code accordingly. Some precondition violations were detected and fixed.
Added helper class, UndigesterUtils, to simplify Undigester logic and free some of its responsibilities.
Development resumed after releasing other projects such as AntMake and ContractChecker, and working on QueryJ.

Code refactored to support ACMSL-Commons 0.5.4. Classpath implemented using dependencies to avoid storing binaries in CVS. Such dependencies are already managed by Maven, but so far no Windows environment is using as development workspace, so using symbolic links seem appropiate till then.
Added support for new features required by WebExtension.
Finished the documentation, along with Maven files.
Implemented a way to allow serailizing object properties as stand-alone elements.
Found in the Internet Betwixt, that provides the functionalities we're implementing in Undigester.
Both rules that manage multiplicity are tested successfully.
The basic code of the rules for managing object collections, is defined: GetNextRule, GetNextIteratorRule and GetNextArrayRule. It introduces some difficulties.
Separated the name extraction logic to a stand-alone rule. GetNameRule. Also, another basic rule is implemented: GetPropertyRule.
Finished the core classes of Undigester: Undigester, Rule and CommonRule. Now the basic usage is defined.
Starting Undigester, taking notes of all development issues, in a pseudo literate-programming way.
Starting the Internet search for an API that support the functional requirements needed to continue working in webextension.
